questions.questionText:
Four people called in reporting the sounds of an apparent burglary. The addresses they gave for the burglary were:

Caller #1: 6249 Jefferson Drive.

Caller #2: 5349 Jefferson Drive.

Caller #3: 6339 Jefferson Drive.

Caller #4: 6349 Jefferson Drive.

Which of the following addresses is most likely correct?

options.text: 6249 Jefferson Drive
6339 Jefferson Drive
5349 Jefferson Drive
6349 Jefferson Drive

questions.questionText:
There was a traffic accident at a very busy intersection. Several witnesses describe the course of events as follows:

Witness #1: The vehicle that was struck was turning left when it was hit by a drunk driver who did not stop at the stop sign.

Witness #2: The vehicle that was struck started too quickly and was hit from the side by a drunk driver.

Witness #3: The vehicle that was struck was beginning its left turn when the man in the blue Chevy came out of nowhere.

Witness #4: A drunken man was coming very fast and ran the stop sign.

Which of the following scenarios is most likely correct?

options.text: A drunken man was coming very fast and ran the stop sign.
The vehicle that was struck started too quickly and was hit from the side by a drunk driver.
The vehicle that was struck was beginning its left turn when the man in the blue Chevy came out of nowhere.
The vehicle that was struck was making a left turn and a drunk driver did not stop at the stop sign.

questions.questionText:
A group of teenagers were seen playing with cigarette lighters near a field of dry grass. The dry grass caught on fire and was burned. Several people saw the group of teenagers and gave the following descriptions:

Clerk #1: Black teenagers wearing baggy clothing.

Clerk #2: White teenagers that were cursing a great deal.

Clerk #3: Hispanic teenagers wearing baggy clothing.

Clerk #4: Hispanic teenagers that had on very large clothing.

Which of the following descriptions of the couple is most likely correct?

options.text: Hispanic teenagers that had on very large clothing
Black teenagers that were cursing a great deal
Hispanic teenagers wearing baggy clothing
White teenagers wearing baggy clothing

questions.questionText:
Several children provided the license plate number and letters of the vehicle they said had offered them a ride home from school. The license plate numbers and letters the children provided were:

Child #1: 876FT.

Child #2: 876PT.

Child #3: S76PT.

Child #4: 876P7.

Which of the following license plate numbers and letters is most likely correct?

options.text: 876FT
876PT
S76PT

questions.questionText:
A young teenage girl has not come home from a friendâ€™s party that she went to right after school and her parents are very concerned. Four people described what they recalled she was wearing earlier in the day.

Person #1: A skirt, a white T-shirt, a blue denim jacket, and white canvas sneakers.

Person #2: A blue skirt, a white tank top, and white sneakers.

Person #3: A dark skirt and a white button down blouse with short sleeves.

Person #4: A blue skirt, a white tank top, and a sweatshirt tied around her waist.

Which of the following descriptions is most likely correct?

options.text: Blue skirt, a white T-shirt, a blue denim jacket, and white canvas sneakers
Blue skirt and a white button down blouse.
Blue skirt, a white tank top, and a sweatshirt tied around her waist.
Blue skirt, a white tank top, and white sneakers.
